coredata.dc:title: An edit-distance model for the approximate matching of timed strings
coredata.prism:publicationName: IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence

abstract.ce:para: An edit-distance model that can be used for the approximate matching of contiguous and non-contiguous timed strings is presented. The model extends the concept of the weighted string-edit distance by introducing timed edit operations and by making the edit costs time dependent. Special attention is paid to the timed null symbols that are associated with the timed insertions and deletions. The usefulness of the presented model is demonstrated on the classification of phone-recognition errors using the TIMIT speech database. © 2009 IEEE.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2009 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: An edit-distance model for the approximate matching of timed strings

affiliation.organization: Laboratory of Artificial Perception, Systems, and Cybernetics (LUKS)
Laboratory of Artificial Perception, Systems, and Cybernetics (LUKS)

abstract.ce:para: An edit-distance model that can be used for the approximate matching of contiguous and non-contiguous timed strings is presented. The model extends the concept of the weighted string-edit distance by introducing timed edit operations and by making the edit costs time dependent. Special attention is paid to the timed null symbols that are associated with the timed insertions and deletions. The usefulness of the presented model is demonstrated on the classification of phone-recognition errors using the TIMIT speech database. © 2009 IEEE.
